intro: Fugosia affinis, commonly known as the golden ragwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments and has a compact, low-growing habit. Its leaves are usually gray-green with a fuzzy texture, and it produces yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in summer. Fugosia affinis is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for various ailments.
